author: Antony Worrall Thompson
method: Heat the wine and sugar in a pan over a gentle heat. Add the peach halves and poach for 8-10 minutes.  For the sabayon, whisk the egg yolks, wine, sugar and vanilla seeds in a bowl over a pan of simmer water for up to 10 minutes, until pale, thickened and fluffy and the mixture leaves a ribbon trail. Remove the peaches from the liquor and transfer to a serving plate. Spoon a little of the sabayon on top and drizzle a little liquor over, to serve.
ingredients: 180ml/6fl oz sweet muscat wine,  30g/1oz caster sugar,  1 peach, cut in half and stone removed,  5 egg yolks,  30ml/1Â¼fl oz muscat wine,  55g/2oz caster sugar,  1 vanilla pod, split and seeds scraped out
